page.title: 04BOLINGE HILL FARM
page.content: Total area of 400 acres. {Crops & {Livestock:}This year's crops are wheat 132 acres, barley 27 acres, maize 25 acres, rape 32 acres and peas 18 acres. Weather has had an adverse effect on the crops. The spring barley was intended to be sold for malting. Some is of the required standard, the rest of the barley will go to 'intervention' to be stored as part of the European grain mountain. Similarly peas were for human consumption but much of the crop will become cattle feed. Maize is made into silage for cattle feed and accounts for their good quality beef cattle. 30 Hereford, 124 Charolais, 20 Limousin and 6 Simmenthal are reared on the pasture areas. { {Mechanisation: }3 workers, 3 tractors with ancillary equipment and 1 combine harvester are based on the farm.
